metadata.title: CVE-2022-0561 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Null source pointer passed as an argument to memcpy() function withinTIFFFetchStripThing() in tif_dirread.c in libtiff versions from 3.9.0 to4.3.0 could lead to Denial of Service via crafted TIFF file. For users thatcompile libtiff from sources, the fix is available with commit eecb0712.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0561` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3
libtiff-tools - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3
libtiff5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3
libtiffxx5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.3').
